com.idevicesinc.sweetblue

Class BleServer.IncomingListener.Please

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.BleServer.IncomingListener.Please
  • Enclosing interface:
    BleServer.IncomingListener

    public static class BleServer.IncomingListener.Please
extends Object
    Struct returned from BleServer.IncomingListener.onEvent(IncomingEvent). Use the static constructor methods to create instances.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static BleServer.IncomingListener.Please doNotRespond()
      Use this as the return value of BleServer.IncomingListener.onEvent(IncomingEvent) when BleServer.ExchangeListener.ExchangeEvent.responseNeeded() is true.
      static BleServer.IncomingListener.Please doNotRespond(BleServer.OutgoingListener listener)
      Same as doNotRespond() but allows you to provide a listener specific to this (non-)response.
      static BleServer.IncomingListener.Please respondWithError(int gattStatus)
      Send an error/status code back to the client.
      static BleServer.IncomingListener.Please respondWithError(int gattStatus, BleServer.OutgoingListener listener)
      Same as respondWithError(int) but allows you to provide a listener specific to this response.
      static BleServer.IncomingListener.Please respondWithSuccess()
      Use this as the return value of BleServer.IncomingListener.onEvent(IncomingEvent) when BleServer.ExchangeListener.ExchangeEvent.responseNeeded() is true and BleServer.ExchangeListener.ExchangeEvent.type() BleServer.ExchangeListener.Type.isWrite() is true and you consider the write successful.
      static BleServer.IncomingListener.Please respondWithSuccess(BleServer.OutgoingListener listener)
      Same as respondWithSuccess() but allows you to provide a listener specific to this response.
      static BleServer.IncomingListener.Please respondWithSuccess(byte[] data)
      Use this as the return value of BleServer.IncomingListener.onEvent(IncomingEvent) when BleServer.ExchangeListener.ExchangeEvent.type() BleServer.ExchangeListener.Type.isRead() is true and you can respect the read request and respond with data.
      static BleServer.IncomingListener.Please respondWithSuccess(byte[] data, BleServer.OutgoingListener listener)
      Same as respondWithSuccess(byte[]) but allows you to provide a listener specific to this response.
      static BleServer.IncomingListener.Please respondWithSuccess(FutureData futureData)
      Overload of respondWithSuccess(byte[]) - see FutureData for why/when you would want to use this.
      static BleServer.IncomingListener.Please respondWithSuccess(FutureData futureData, BleServer.OutgoingListener listener)
      Overload of respondWithSuccess(byte[], BleServer.OutgoingListener) - see FutureData for why/when you would want to use this.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • doNotRespond

        public static BleServer.IncomingListener.Please doNotRespond()
        Use this as the return value of BleServer.IncomingListener.onEvent(IncomingEvent) when BleServer.ExchangeListener.ExchangeEvent.responseNeeded() is true.

      • doNotRespond

        public static BleServer.IncomingListener.Please doNotRespond(BleServer.OutgoingListener listener)
        Same as doNotRespond() but allows you to provide a listener specific to this (non-)response. Your BleServer.OutgoingListener.onEvent(BleServer.OutgoingListener.OutgoingEvent) will simply be called with BleServer.OutgoingListener.Status.NO_RESPONSE_ATTEMPTED.
        See Also:
        BleServer.setListener_Outgoing(BleServer.OutgoingListener)

      • respondWithSuccess

        public static BleServer.IncomingListener.Please respondWithSuccess(FutureData futureData)
        Overload of respondWithSuccess(byte[]) - see FutureData for why/when you would want to use this.

      • respondWithSuccess

        public static BleServer.IncomingListener.Please respondWithSuccess(FutureData futureData,
                                                                   BleServer.OutgoingListener listener)
        Overload of respondWithSuccess(byte[], BleServer.OutgoingListener) - see FutureData for why/when you would want to use this.

      • respondWithSuccess

        public static BleServer.IncomingListener.Please respondWithSuccess(byte[] data)
        Use this as the return value of BleServer.IncomingListener.onEvent(IncomingEvent) when BleServer.ExchangeListener.ExchangeEvent.type() BleServer.ExchangeListener.Type.isRead() is true and you can respect the read request and respond with data.

      • respondWithSuccess

        public static BleServer.IncomingListener.Please respondWithSuccess(byte[] data,
                                                                   BleServer.OutgoingListener listener)
        Same as respondWithSuccess(byte[]) but allows you to provide a listener specific to this response.
        See Also:
        BleServer.setListener_Outgoing(OutgoingListener)

      • respondWithSuccess

        public static BleServer.IncomingListener.Please respondWithSuccess()
        Use this as the return value of BleServer.IncomingListener.onEvent(IncomingEvent) when BleServer.ExchangeListener.ExchangeEvent.responseNeeded() is true and BleServer.ExchangeListener.ExchangeEvent.type() BleServer.ExchangeListener.Type.isWrite() is true and you consider the write successful.

      • respondWithSuccess

        public static BleServer.IncomingListener.Please respondWithSuccess(BleServer.OutgoingListener listener)
        Same as respondWithSuccess() but allows you to provide a listener specific to this response.
        See Also:
        BleServer.setListener_Outgoing(OutgoingListener)

      • respondWithError

        public static BleServer.IncomingListener.Please respondWithError(int gattStatus)
        Send an error/status code back to the client. See static final int members of BleStatuses starting with GATT_ for possible values.

      • respondWithError

        public static BleServer.IncomingListener.Please respondWithError(int gattStatus,
                                                                 BleServer.OutgoingListener listener)
        Same as respondWithError(int) but allows you to provide a listener specific to this response.
        See Also:
        BleServer.setListener_Outgoing(OutgoingListener)
